page.title: 14Old folk in Chapeltown.
page.content: The majority of over 60's questioned were{satisfied with their lifestyle, although a number found their{state pension inadequate. Existing facilities in the area are:- {Chapeltown Nursing Home}- state owned, catering for 30 residents requiring a high level of nursing support. {Housley Manor}- privately owned, for fee paying and state-aided residents. {Ernest Copley House}and{John Tricket {House}- both state owned, providing sheltered accomodation. A number of purpose built council dwellings exist in the area, besides the many private homes owned by elderly people. The{W.R.V.S}provide a {'meals on wheels'}service. The church organises a{'luncheon club'}which has regular meetings and outings. A number of old people are regularly visited by the doctor/nurse or{'home helps'.
